title: Space-made weld scrutinised in ESA lab
summary: ESA engineers have focused microscopes, hardness testers and an X-ray computer aided tomography machine onto a special aluminium weld just a single centimetre across – the historic result of the very first autonomous welding to be performed in space, and the first ESA has been involved with.

title: First Stage for Vega C Return to Flight Arrives at Launch Pad
summary: The P120 solid-fuel first stage that will power the Vega C rocket’s return-to-flight mission has been transferred to the ZLV launch pad at the Guiana Space Centre. Following the failure of the rocket’s second flight, Vega C was grounded until an investigation could be completed. The rocket’s time on the ground was extended after a […]

title: Negar Feher, CEO, Orbital Outpost X – Leading Women in Space
summary: In this episode of the SpaceNews Leading Women in Space series, correspondent Debra Werner speaks with Negar Feher, CEO, Orbital Outpost X.

title: Volta Space Technologies unveils plans for lunar power satellite network
summary: A startup has unveiled plans to develop a network of satellites around the moon to provide power to spacecraft on the lunar surface.

title: ViaSat-3 satellite begins service for U.S. Marine Corps
summary: The satellite, which covers the Americas, is now supporting the Marine Wing Communications Squadron 38 and the 3rd Marine Littoral Regiment

title: Sound of Earth’s magnetic flip 41 000 years ago
summary: Approximately 41 000 years ago, Earth’s magnetic field briefly reversed during what is known as the Laschamp event. During this time, Earth’s magnetic field weakened significantly—dropping to a minimum of 5% of its current strength—which allowed more cosmic rays to reach Earth’s atmosphere.

title: First all-new MetOp complete and sibling in testing
summary: With all instruments integrated, the first MetOp Second Generation-A, MetOp-SG-A1, weather satellite is now fully assembled and on schedule for liftoff next year. Meanwhile, its sibling, MetOp-SG-B1, is undergoing rigorous testing to ensure that it will withstand the vacuum and extreme temperature swings of space.

title: Space Operations Automation Startup AIKO Secures €3.5M in Funding
summary: Torino-based AIKO has secured €3.5 million in Series A funding to expand its presence in Europe and extend its reach into the US market. AIKO was founded in 2017 and offers a suite of AI-powered software solutions for automating the operation of satellites and space infrastructure, including in-orbit maneuvering and data processing. On 9 October, […]

title: NASA “really looking forward” to next Starship test flight
summary: As SpaceX prepares for the test flight of its Starship vehicle, NASA is closely watching as it waits for the company to achieve the next milestones on development of the lunar lander version of the vehicle.

title: The Marshall Star for October 9, 2024
summary: Marshall Lends Insight, Expertise to Auburn Aerospace Industry Day Event By Rick Smith Nearly 500 students and faculty of Auburn University gathered on campus Sept. 30-Oct. 2 to hear lectures from leading NASA propulsion and engineering experts and to talk careers goals and opportunities with representatives of the U.S. space program and various aerospace industry […]
